message.content:
cs.SY, cs.MA, cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with the problem of distributed state estimation of a linear time-invariant (LTI) system by a network of sensors. This problem is related to control theory and networked systems, which are subfields of systems and control (cs.SY). The paper also discusses the use of consensus dynamics, which is a common technique in multi-agent systems and distributed computing, falling under the categories of multi-agent systems (cs.MA) and networking and internet architecture (cs.NI). The paper proposes a new class of distributed observers, which involves constructing appropriate Luenberger observers, a technique commonly used in control theory and estimation, falling under the category of distributed, parallel, and cluster computing (cs.DC). Finally, the paper discusses the possibility of faults or attacks at the nodes, which is a topic in the field of artificial intelligence (cs.AI).
